title: Chesapeake Bay Common Fish
description: Five most common fish in Chesapeake Bay with appearance and fishery rules.

cards.back: Silver with dark stripes, season Apr-Dec, min length 28 inches, daily limit 2.
Blue-tinted claws, season May-Dec, min size 5 inches, daily limit 12 crabs.
Silver body, spiny dorsal fin, no closed season, daily limit 30.
Long, snake-like with dark brown color, season May-Sep, daily limit 25.
Silver scales, oily fish, no minimum size, commercial harvest regulated.
Whiskered barbels, spotted body, no closed season, daily limit 20.
Pale body, barbels around mouth, no closed season, daily limit 20.
Silver with greenish back, runs Apr-May, catch and release encouraged.
Bronze color with dark spots, no closed season, daily limit 25.
Silver with black spot on side, no closed season, daily limit 50.

prompt: Create a deck of the five most common fish found in the Chesapeake Bay and its estuaries. Include only fish, no shellfish.  On the front of each card, put the name of the fish.  On the back, put a brief description of it's appearance and related fishery rules for the species (e.g., Season, Minimum Keep Length, Daily Catch Limit).
